author: A_Brickset_user
review: This is an excellent standalone set that shows what can be done with a good selection of Lego along with creative building.  The picture above does not do justice to the many impressive models contained in the instruction manual.  Notable alternate models include two firetrucks, a formula one car, a wide body dump truck, a semi trailer with a submarine, a pickup truck with a glider, a couple of tow trucks, a sports car, a fork lift, a combine/harvester with a tractor and trailer hitch.  Instructions are not included for all models shown.  It also appears that multiple models (shown on the same page) can be made at the same time which increases the fun factor.  Youngsters can start with the basic models and then progress to more complex versions of similar vehicles as their interest grows.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great value and investment.
review:
This is one of the better, if not best, Lego sets. Many of the pieces are more versatile than the ones you find in, say, World City sets. Many of the pieces are wheels, plates, and bricks. There are some lights and windows and vent things. Unlike other sets (such as World City), this Lego set lets your mind run wild. With World City sets, it's hard to come up with something else because they're mostly customized pieces. With this designer set, most of the pieces are generic, ergo it's easy to make something else. You'll probably never even look in the instruction booklet. I know I didn't.

Plus, at eight cents a pieces, it's a pretty good value. Next time, I'm going to get the other designer set (the one with the yellow semi + flatbed truck. It's only 9.99 and has 200 pieces! 5 cents a piece!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Good,but ...
review:
Well it's a good set,but there are some pieces,that are a bit big.And it's lacking a steering wheel and Minifig-Scaled Models,they're all a little smaller than 
Minifig-scale,which I don't like so.But if you let your imagination running around and if you fetch a minifig and a steering Wheel,you can really build some Mnifig-scaled Models out of it.I like the clear Windows,which I haven't seen much in sets of the 90's or newer.Well the wheel holders and the wheels itself are a little simplified,but unlike in the juniorized sets from 1997 to 2000,they're useful.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: I'm like a bad itch. I won't go away!
review:
Hey, guys! I'm back! 

MAIN TRUCK WITH SUBMARINE: 9/10. Only bad thing is that there isn't much playability. EXCELLENT structual integrity.

TOW TRUCK  AND SEMI TRUCK (mini): 10/10 for sure. If they could give it a trailer, It would get a 11/10. Still fun.

FORKLIFT: 12/10. One of me favorite models in the book. Lift works like a charm.

PICKUP WITH PLANE: 8/10. PLANE ROCKS! (only bad part is no instructions) (just pictures)

RALLY CAR AND DUNE BUGGY: 10/10. GREAT job with this part, TLC. I am so excited that it could be build symoltainiously.

TOW-TRUCK: (BIG), 10/10. fUN.

MOTORCYCLE: 3/10. Aweful. Just aweful. NO INSTRUCTIONS! REALLY HARD TO BUILD! (maybe if I'm going to get instructions for it, it would of turned out better).

author: Exo_brick
title: Best of the Creator
review:
If you want to build cars, this is the best set!I got this at K-Mart for 26.00, I don't   know the s@h price, my dad bought it for me when I was six.Oh the memories half my life ago, great, fun. 

Pros:
-Models are great
-Parts are VERY useful
-Just great

Cons:
-I really don't want to say this but, *gulps* no cons.

author: jonbuddy
title: One of my favorites.
review:
I truly love this Creator (I'm sorry- "Make and Create."). It's a great way to get red and white pieces and also Wheels and Axles. I bought it at Sears a while back, but it wasn't back in 2003 when I bought it. It was like '06 or '07.

Good:
Endless possibilities- not just 35!
Great creations
Easy to build
Easy to imagine more creations
Crane pieces
A good way to get red and white pieces (as I've mentioned above)
Windshield piece(s)
Plenty of Wheels and Axles

Bad:
NOTHING!

Overall:
A great set-buy it!

5/5
OR
10/10

author: modena
title: What a delight!
review:
This set was such a nice addition, it doesn't give you 35 sets, but an infinity!

Pros:

  • So many creations!
  • Rare parts!
  • Fantastic colours!
  • Crane arm and hook! 
  • Lots of ideas!
  • Hinging parts!
  • Lots of themes! (Farming, racing, fire fighting, cargo, and MUCH more!)
  • Lots of lights!

Cons:

  • Too old. (I can't get another one!)

Overall:

This was such a nice set when I was little. It was the first set that I started building my own creations with. There are lots of nice parts, and building a car for your favourite minifigure is so easy! You can build at any theme, farming, racing... You name it!

If you see this set, get it immediately! You will really enjoy it!

author: n_zone
title: Don't call yourself a Lego car lover if you don't have this set
review:
I got this set when I was 10 and even to this day I use these bricks, wheels and even ideas to make my own dream car.

 

Pros

  • Pro 1: Huge variety of bricks, wheels, models and theme
  • Pro 2: Appeals to kids, TFOLs and AFOLs
  • Pro 3: Encourages to build MOC (My own creation)
  • Pro 4: Lots of good variety models and ideas
  • Pro 5: Very high playability

Cons

  • Con 1: Not suitable for people who have little creativeness on cars
  • Con 2: If you didn't got this, good luck finding and owning it 
 
What makes it a real gem is the vast amount of themes and ideas to build (like emergency, race, agriculture, etc.) and the right pieces to build your own dream car. This is the ultimate set for car lovers.
 
An easy 10 out of 10 for me.

author: RandomReviewerBros
title: Oh the Memories...
review:
I just felt like writing a review on this set as I have the fondest memories of this set, I would have been 5 years old when I got this and it was the first proper LEGO set I ever received after Duplo. The memories I have are happy and sad at the same time and this review will be based purely off what I remember as a kid playing with this set with my Dad.

Parts

The parts in this set are great, I still have them all to this day but they are mixed in with thousands of other parts Ive gotten since...

Like all Creator sets there is a wide variety of parts and styles of parts, you can take a look at the inventory above :)

The build

This is the fun part, back in the day 12 years ago, Creator sets offered way more than just the "3 in 1" they offer today. There were 35 different possibilities of creations and the instruction booklet offered just that, albeit some were small but at least they gave you the option of many creations.

The completed model

Now for the completed model I'm going to go back to my favorite memory of this set, you can see the truck on the photo provided by Brickset above, that was the biggest model and as a 5 year old you thought that 299 pieces was a lot (at least compared to the size of sets I build today) and my dad would help me build the truck and I remember being so happy and proud of myself when I finished it, its a very happy memory for me but at the same time sad because of how fast my life has seemed to go...

Overall opinion

I myself have rated this set 5 stars across the board based purely off the fact of the amazing memories I have with this set, I do recommend it for a younger kid who is starting out with LEGO and I'm sure it doesn't go for too much online :)
